titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Anne Harney

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:24-0400

did.abstract: There are 153 letters in this collection, many addressed to Aubrey Lackington Moore, an English writer who tried to reconcile evolution and traditional Christianity. Some letters discuss scientific questions of the day, while others are formal social notes. Also includes 24 clipped signatures, inlcuding those of Sir Henry Wentworth Acland; Goerge Bentham; H. A. Bruce; S. H. Butcher; Matthewss Duncan; Percy Gardner; George Gritchett; G. Grote; Alfred Cort Haddon; Sir Prescott Gardner Hewitt; William Guyer Hunter; Thomas Henry Huxley; John Lingard; Thomas Babington Macauley; Miss K. Aubrey Moore; Louis Pasteur; Sir John Russell Reynolds, bart.; Thomas Smith; James Leigh Strachan-Davidson; Agnes Strickland; and Arthur Thomason.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: The Moore Autograph Collection contains a series of individual letters that E.M. Morre collected in the twentieth century. The letters are primarily from British thinkers written in the nineteenth century, especially the 1880s and 1890s.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Fleming (Sotheby, nos. 229 and 232; $150.76) and accessioned, 1961 (1961 1440ms).

controlaccess.persname: Fletcher, C. R. L., (Charles Robert Leslie), 1857-1934
controlaccess.subject: Beyond Early America
Evolution.
Science.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: D. 153 items (letters and documents) and 24 autographs (clipped from letters, etc). Various sizes. Many of these pertain directly to Aubrey Lackington Moore, Who attempted to reconcile the evolution-religion controversy. Table of contents available.

scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. Incomplete. (see Moore autograph collection.) Will forward publication if he wishes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Moore autograph collection.) Has news on a medium for spiritualism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. (see Moore autograph collection.) Invites her to his lecture. Nov. 24.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oxford, A.L.S. 2p. (see Moore autograph collection.) States that his brother's work was definitely second class. Dec. 22.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.in 3rd.P. 1p. (see Moore autograph collection.) June 5. Cannot accept invitation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. Fragment. (see Moore autograph collection.) Returns borrowed volume by one of his sons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Oxford, A.L.S. 1p. (see Moore autograph collection.) Will come to her garden party alone. July 20.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S.with initials. 2p. (see Moore autograph collection.) Forwards item and appreciates his sermon.
